is a village in the county of
. It has less than 750 residents but is popular with visitors for its sandy beaches on the Anglesey coast, local bird life and idyllic countryside views.

value: Birdlife around Llyn Maelog or Maelog lake
. This 65 acres lake is a designated Site of Special Scientific Interest. Follow the footpath around it to get a glimps of the many species that live and breed here.
Enjoy Rhosneigr beach life and the water sports available. Take a swim, go
, kite surfing, wakeboarding, water skiing, or underwater diving.
Go fishing in the lake or on the sea.
Take a swing at the 18 hole golf course of the Anglesey Golf Club
Bring your own bike or rent one locally, to explore the pleasant countryside surrounding the village.
